title: David's Morning Prayer
shortSummary: Psalm 5 is a heartfelt morning prayer of David, seeking God's attentive ear and righteous guidance amid opposition. It contrasts the wickedness of David's enemies with the mercy and protection God grants to the righteous, emphasizing trust in God's justice and faithfulness.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and King of Israel who earnestly prays for God's guidance and protection against his enemies.

keyCharacters.name: The LORD
keyCharacters.description: God, the sovereign King and righteous judge to whom David directs his prayer and trust.

definitions.definition: A musical term or tune to which this psalm was to be sung, possibly referring to a type of flute or melody.
An archaic term meaning falsehood or lying, referring to deceitful speech.
A metaphor describing a throat as a tomb that is open and unclean, symbolizing corrupt and deadly speech.
The quality of being morally right or justifiable, often used in the Bible to describe God's holy standard and the believer's conduct.

outline.heading: David’s Plea for God’s Attention
outline.description: David begins by asking God to listen to his words and prayers, emphasizing his habit of morning devotion and his reliance on God as King and God.

outline.heading: God’s Hatred of Wickedness
outline.description: David declares God's intolerance of evil and deceit, highlighting that God will not tolerate workers of iniquity and will destroy the deceitful and violent.

outline.heading: David’s Worship and Request for Guidance
outline.description: David expresses his reverence and worship in God’s house, asking God to lead him in righteousness and to make a straight path before him in the face of enemies.

outline.heading: The Character of the Wicked
outline.description: David describes the deceitful nature of his enemies, calling for God’s judgment upon them because of their rebellion and unfaithfulness.

outline.heading: Blessings for the Faithful
outline.description: The psalm concludes with a call for those who trust in God to rejoice, affirming that God blesses and protects the righteous as with a shield.

application: Begin each day with intentional prayer, seeking God’s guidance and expressing dependence on Him.
Reject and avoid all forms of deceit and wickedness, knowing God hates such behavior.
Trust in God’s protection and justice when facing opposition or enemies.
Rejoice and find confidence in God’s faithful blessings and shield of favor around the righteous.

keyVerses.text: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the importance of beginning the day with prayer and dependence on God.

keyVerses.text: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.
keyVerses.significance: It affirms God’s holy nature and His intolerance of sin, setting the foundation for righteous living.

keyVerses.text: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.
keyVerses.significance: A powerful plea for divine guidance and protection amid adversaries, emphasizing reliance on God’s righteousness.

keyVerses.text: For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.
keyVerses.significance: This verse assures believers of God’s protective favor surrounding and blessing the righteous.
